What is the significance of digital signatures in the context of Verus ID?

Digital signatures form the basis for any attestation of one party to the validity of another, and have numerous applications beyond just verification and authenticity. They can be used to establish trust, prove ownership, and create new opportunities for business and innovation.

Verus ID enables free verifiable digital signatures for all through the Verus ID protocol as just one of the many new capabilities it enables. It is also the foundation upon which many new applications and additional capabilities can be built.For example, using Verus ID signatures, it’s possible for any journalist anywhere to sign photos, videos, and content, establish a reputation for authenticity, and counter the potential for deep-fakes to make the truth harder to find. Open source projects can now create their own identities and digitally sign their binary releases, ensuring that not only can a file be verified by hash as the one downloaded from a particular server, but by signature as the actual file initially signed by the developer or release engineer. Signatures also form the basis for any attestation of one party to the validity of another. In fact, there are so many applications for digital signatures, from things listed already, to physical entry systems, to workflow applications, to new earning opportunities that a full discussion of use cases would overwhelm these release notes.In any case, we are happy to release digital signatures for all, and we hope you enjoy using this new, simple capability, maybe even think of a new use case you’d like to pursue yourself as a business opportunity on the Verus Network!# Verus ID Verus IDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. What is the nature of Verus IDs, and how do they differ from other blockchain ID implementations?

Verus IDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. Unlike most blockchain ID implementations, there is no corporation involved in the protocol, making Verus IDs decentralized and community-driven. This enables plenty of opportunities for identity applications and innovations.

What are some potential use cases for digital signatures enabled by Verus ID?

Some potential use cases for digital signatures enabled by Verus ID include:

* Journalists signing photos, videos, and content to establish a reputation for authenticity and counter deep-fakes.
* Open source projects creating their own identities and digitally signing their binary releases to ensure verification and authenticity.
* Physical entry systems.
* Workflow applications.
* New earning opportunities.
